title: Discharge of chapter 13 trustee and order closing case.
question: Within the last week, a document with the title above was filed in my case. in order is says says: it is ordered that the chapter 13 trustee is discharged, and the trustees bond is exonerated, and this case is closed.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Chapter 13 bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Chapter 13 bankruptcy reorganization plan
answers: Did you complete the 2nd half of your financial counseling? If not, you did not get a discharge. If yes, talk to your lawyer or call the court to ask for a copy of your discharge.

You should have received your bankruptcy discharge several months ago. The order you received closes your case, which could have happened even if you were DENIED YOUR DISCHARGE. If you made your Plan payments as required you should have received a Discharge. Check your file on www.pacer.gov and look for a document labeled simply DISCHARGE. Hope this perspective helps!

This is not the Debtor's discharge. This is a document that basically indicates the trustee's job is complete, their obligations to act as trustee have ended, and the case is now closed. If you did not receive the Discharge of Debtor, there may be a problem. You should call the court to find out what happened.

This does not say that your debts are discharged, but that the case is closed.
Review with your attorney to see if your discharge came under a separate document so stating.

No . A discharge is another document. have your attorney send you one, call the ch 13 trustee, or go to the court and download a copy assuming you received one. Call the court to ask if the docket shows in fact a discharge and when it was mailed out! If NOT, call your attorney immediately.

Did you complete the 2nd half of your financial counseling? If not, you did not get a discharge. If yes, talk to your lawyer or call the court to ask for a copy of your discharge.
